EasyISA

Apply now

With our Easy ISA your money is invested in our MyFolio Managed fund.


Let's look at some information about MyFolio Managed funds, so you can understand the potential for growth and the risks that come with it.

You make one decision, our experts will do the rest

Simply choose how much or how little risk you're happy taking and the experts who manage MyFolio Funds will aim get the best possible returns.

Choose a risk level and we'll show you the MyFolio designed to match.

MyFolio managed I

Low
  • Fluctuations in value some short term periods of fluctuation
  • Investment risk conservative, small
  • Potential for returns modest or relatively stable returns

How has it performed over the last 5 years?

Graph

Where is your money invested?

The experts who manage MyFolio Funds invest across the globe, and in different types of investments to try and get the best possible returns for the risk level you're happy taking.

This map shows the countries and regions where MyFolio Managed I invests.

Map

50% UK

15% North America

Etc

This chart shows the types of investments MyFolio Managed I invests in.

Chart

More detailed information on where MyFolio Managed I invests. MyFolio Managed I fund factsheet (pdf | 1.5MB)

The value of investments within the fund can fall as well as rise and is not guaranteed – you may get back less than you pay in.

Data provided by FE. Care has been taken to ensure that the information is correct but it neither warrants, represents nor guarantees the contents of the information, nor does it accept any responsibility for errors, inaccuracies, omissions or any inconsistencies herein.
Performance. Source: FE (Performance data). These figures are based on performance from DD/MM/YYYY to DD/MM/YYYY. They are calculated using the fund’s bid price, which is the price you receive when you sell units in a fund, and assumes that any gross income the fund generates is reinvested. It also takes into account the charges which apply to the fund.
Diversification. Source: These figures are based on information as at DD/MM/YYYY.
